intro: Pavetta chevalieri, commonly known as the chevalier pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or shrublands. The fruit is a small, two-lobed capsule that releases seeds when mature.
